block.p: Great seats for the Fourth of July fireworks on the East River, and an all-American buffet dinner (including shrimp, lobster, fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, pie and ice cream, not to mention sushi) with an open bar, will be held at Water's Edge, 44th Drive at the East River in Long Island City, Queens. It's $150 a person ($75 for those under 12), plus tax and tip. Reservations: (718) 482-0033.

On Saturday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Farmer's Museum in Cooperstown, N.Y., there will be an Asian barbecue organized by Cendrillon restaurant in Manhattan. Asian food experts, including Nicole Routhier and Sri Owen, will do cooking demonstrations and serve tasting plates. Brewery Ommegang in Cooperstown will pour its beers. Admission is $5 for adults, $2.50 for children under 12. Tasting plates are $2 each. Information: (888) 547-1450.

The following Saturday, July 8, Brewery Ommegang will display its roots with a Belgian festival, including food and beer for sampling and sale at the brewery, River Road, Cooperstown, N.Y., from 1 to 5 p.m. There is no admission charge.

The annual Chefs and Champagne benefit for the James Beard Foundation will be held on July 8 from 5 to 8 p.m. at Wolffer Estate, 139 Sagg Road, Sagaponack, N.Y. Tickets are $125 for members, $150 for non-members: (212) 627-2308.
